tit.e: Yushi Naishinno-ke no Kii (Kii of Princess Yushi's Household)
Yushi Naishinno-ke no Kii (Kii of Princess Yushi's Household)
tit.cmt: (Kii of Princess Yushi's Household)次のセルに説明があるので、削除しました。

sen.j: 祐子内親王家紀伊（ゆうしないしんのうけ の きい、生没年不詳）は、平安時代院政期の女流歌人で、後朱雀天皇の皇女祐子内親王の女房。
sen.e: Yushi Naishinno-ke no Kii (Kii of Princess Yushi's Household, dates unknown) was a Japanese poetess during the cloistered government period of the Heian era, and a lady-in-waiting to the Imperial Princess Yushi, the daughter of the Emperor Gosuzaku.

Yushi Naishinno-ke no Kii (Kii of Princess Yushi's Household, dates unknown) was a Japanese poetess during the cloistered government period of the Heian era, and a lady-in-waiting to the Imperial Princess Yushi, the daughter of the Emperor Gosuzaku.

Yushi Naishinno-ke no Kii (Kii of Princess Yushi's Household, year of birth and death unknown) was a poetess during the cloistered government period of the Heian period, and a lady-in-waiting to the Imperial Princess Yushi, the daughter of the Emperor Gosuzaku.

sen.j: 一宮紀伊、紀伊君とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: She was also called Ichi no Miya no Kii and Kii no Kimi.
She was also called Ichi no Miya no Kii and Kii no Kimi.
She was also called Ichi no Miya no Kii and Kii no Kimi.

sen.j: 従五位上民部大輔春宮亮平経方の娘とも、藤原師長の娘である堀河院御乳母典侍紀伊三位師子と同一人物ともいわれており父親は定かではない。
sen.e: She is said to have been the daughter of TAIRA no Tsunekata, Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), Minbu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs), Togu no suke (Assistant Master in the Crown Prince's Quarters), or even the very same woman as 堀河院御乳母典侍紀伊三位師子 who was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Moronaga, but her real father is still unknown.
sen.cmt: 「堀河院御乳母典侍紀伊三位師子」の最後の人名が読み不明のため、原文のままにしております。
sen.e: She is said to have been the daughter of TAIRA no Tsunekata, Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), Minbu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs), Togu no suke (Assistant Master in the Crown Prince's Quarters), or even the very same woman as 堀河院御乳母典侍紀伊三位師子 who was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Moronaga, but her real father is still unknown.

She is said to have been the daughter of TAIRA no Tsunekata, Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), Minbu taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs), Togu no suke (Assistant Master in the Crown Prince's Quarters), or even the very same woman as 堀河院御乳母典侍紀伊三位師子 who was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Moronaga, but her real father is still unknown.

sen.j: 母は「岩垣沼の中将」の作者祐子内親王家小弁（こべん）。
sen.e: Her mother was Yushi Naishinno-ke no KoBen (KoBen of Princess Yushi's Household), the author of 'Iwagakinuma-no Chujo'.
Her mother was Yushi Naishinno-ke no KoBen (KoBen of Princess Yushi's Household), the author of 'Iwagakinuma-no Chujo.'
Her mother was Yushi Naishinno-ke no Koben (Koben of Princess Yushi's Household), the author of 'Iwagakinuma-no Chujo.'

sen.j: 紀伊守藤原重経（素意法師）は兄とも夫とも言われている。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Shigetsune (Soi Hoshi), the Governor of Kii Province, is said to have been her brother or her husband.
FUJIWARA no Shigetsune (Soi Hoshi), the Governor of Kii Province, is said to have been her brother or her husband.
FUJIWARA no Shigetsune (Soi Hoshi), the Governor of Kii Province, is said to have been her brother or her husband.

sen.j: 歌合への出詠は1056年（天喜4年）「皇后宮春秋歌合」から、1113年（永久元年）「定通朝臣家歌合」まで確認されている。
sen.e: Her composition of poems for uta-awase (poetry contests) has been identified in the period between 'Kogogu Shunju Uta-awase' (The Empress' Spring and Autumn Poem Match) in 1056 (the fourth year of Tengi era) and the '定通朝臣家歌合' in 1113 (the first year of Eikyu era).
sen.cmt: 「定通朝臣家歌合」の最後の人名が読み不明のため、原文のままにしております。
sen.e: Her composition of poems for uta-awase (poetry contests) has been identified in the period between 'Kogogu Shunju Uta-awase' (The Empress' Spring and Autumn Poem Match) in 1056 (the fourth year of Tengi era) and the '定通朝臣家歌合' in 1113 (the first year of Eikyu era).

Her composition of poems for uta-awase (poetry contests) has been identified in the period between 'Kogogu Shunju Uta-awase' (The Empress' Spring and Autumn Poem Match) in 1056 and the 'Sadamichi Asonke no utaawase (Sadamichi Ason's poetry contest)' in 1113.
sen.cmt: (the fourth year of Tengi era) (the first year of Eikyu era)削除用語統一

sen.j: 『後拾遺和歌集』以下の勅撰和歌集に29首入集。
sen.e: 29 poems of hers were selected for Goshui Wakashu (Later Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poetry) and other subsequent Chokusen wakashu (anthologies of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command).

29 poems of hers were selected for Goshui Wakashu (Later Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poetry) and other subsequent Chokusen wakashu (anthologies of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command).

29 poems of hers were selected for "Goshui Wakashu" (Later Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poetry) and other subsequent Chokusen wakashu (anthologies of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command).

sen.j: 家集に「一宮紀伊集」がある。
sen.e: She left a personal collection 'Ichi no Miya no Kii Shu'.
She left a personal collection 'Ichi no Miya no Kii Shu.'
She left a personal collection 'Ichi no Miya no Kii Shu.'
"Ogura Hyakunin Isshu" ("The Ogura's Sequence of One Hundred Poems by One Hundred Poets")
"Ogura Hyakunin Isshu" ("The Ogura's Sequence of One Hundred Poems by One Hundred Poets")
Ogura Hyakunin Isshu (the Ogura Anthology of One Hundred Tanka-poems by One Hundred Poets)

sen.j: 72番 音に聞く 高師の浜の あだ波は かけじや袖の 濡れもこそすれ（「金葉和歌集」恋下501）
sen.e: 72. It would be better not to take seriously the words of someone notorious for being flirtatious, or something that I might weep bitterly will happen. ('Kinyo wakashu', Love II, 501)
72. It would be better not to take seriously the words of someone notorious for being flirtatious, or something that I might weep bitterly will happen. ('Kinyo wakashu', Love II, 501)
No. 72: It would be better not to take seriously the words of someone notorious for being flirtatious, or something that I might weep bitterly will happen. ('Kinyo wakashu', Love II, 501)
sen.cmt: No. 72: 他ファイルに合わせる
